intro: Mimulus moschatus flore-pleno, commonly known as the full-flowered yellow monkeyflower, is a striking member of the Phrymaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow flowers, which are typically tubular with a distinctive spur at the back. The plant is native to the western United States and thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, due to their nectar-rich structure. The plant is typically herbaceous, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal.
